meanings.definition: A person who designs sets for theatrical productions.
meanings.sent1: The talented scenographer created a stunning backdrop for the play.
meanings.sent2: The scenographer carefully planned the stage layout for the upcoming show.
meanings.sent3: The scenographer accidentally painted the set upside down, creating a hilarious scene.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a scenographer, crafting intricate worlds with each stroke of the brush.
meanings.sent5: The scenographer's vision transformed the empty stage into a magical realm.

meanings.definition: The art or practice of designing sets for theatrical productions.
meanings.sent1: Learning about scenography helped her understand the importance of stage design.
meanings.sent2: Scenography plays a crucial role in bringing a theatrical production to life.
meanings.sent3: The class on scenography turned out to be more fun than she expected.
meanings.sent4: His imagination soared as he delved into the world of scenography.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of scenography lies in its ability to transport the audience to different worlds.
